page.title: 03LANGUAGE AT YSGOL BODFARI
page.content: Ysgol Bodfari is a rural school in the Vale of Clwyd.In the past the bilingual nature of the school has been very prominent in that a number of children have Welsh as a first language while others have English as their first language. By 1985 the character of the school and the village is changing. Out of the sixty full time pupils at school there are only two with both parents speaking Welsh.By next year this figure will be reduced to one.There are a few children in school where one parent speaks Welsh but the language spoken at home is English. The children whose first language is English are taught Welsh as a second language.
